lj.lj_ly: the seeds of dissension had been sown.

phrase.cizu_name: you can't make a silk purse out of a sow's ear

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)you can't create a fine product from inferior materials

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sāwan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zaaien and German säen
Old English sugu; related to Dutch zeug, German Sau, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sus and Greek hus 'pig'

encyclopedia.content: 词典解释 sow英音：[səu]美音：[so]sow 及物动词 vt. 1.播锛堉诛級 He plowed the land and then sowed the seeds. 他先翻土，然后播种。2.播种于锛埻恋氐蕊級[(+with)] The farmer sowed the field with wheat. 农夫在地里播上小麦种子。3.散布，传播 He tried to sow discontent among us. 他企图在我们中间散布不满情绪。4.使密布[H][(+with)] 不及物动词 vi. 1.播种 The farmers here sow once a year. 这里的农民一

entry.def: If you sow seeds or sow an area of land with seeds, you plant the seeds in the ground.

example.ex: Sow the seed in a warm place in February/March...
example.tran: 2 月或 3 月里把种子播种在温暖的地方。

example.ex: Yesterday the field opposite was sown with maize.
example.tran: 昨天对面的田里播种了玉米。

entry.def: If someone sows an undesirable feeling or situation, they cause it to begin and develop.

example.ex: He cleverly sowed doubts into the minds of his rivals...
example.tran: 他巧妙地令对手心生疑窦。

example.ex: Instead, the session has sowed confusion.
example.tran: 相反，这次会议却引发了混乱。

entry.tran: 播下了…的种子;开始了(某一进程)
entry.def: If one thing sows the seeds of another, it starts the process which leads eventually to the other thing.

example.ex: Rich industrialised countries have sown the seeds of global warming.
example.tran: 富庶的工业国家播下了全球变暖的种子。

entry.def: A sow is an adult female pig.

means.word_mean: 1. place (seeds) in or on the ground for future growth;
3. place seeds in or on (the ground);
